title:
Natural measures and statistical properties of non-statistical maps with
  multiple neutral fixed points
authors: Douglas Coates, Ian Melbourne and Amin Talebi
abstract:
In this article we show that a large class of infinite measure preserving
dynamical systems that do not admit physical measures nevertheless exhibit
strong statistical properties. In particular, we give sufficient conditions for
existence of a distinguished natural measure $\nu$ such that the pushforwards
of any absolutely continuous probability measure converge to $\nu$. Moreover,
we obtain a distributional limit law for empirical measures. We also extend
existing results on the characterisation of the set of almost sure limit points
for empirical measures. Our results apply to various intermittent maps with
multiple neutral fixed points preserving an infinite $\sigma$-finite absolutely
continuous measure.
